concept-wr.title: System Configuration Management Using the CLI
concept-wr.shortdesc: You can use the CLI to make changes to the system configuration after installation.

conbody.p: For information about the types of configuration changes you can make, and guidelines for implementing them on an operational system, see . During some configuration changes, system alarms are raised; for help viewing them from the CLI, see .

To make configuration changes using the CLI, you must log in as user wrsroot to the active controller and source the script /etc/nova/openrc to obtain Keystone administrative privileges. Updated following xref. Now local to this document (new ID).For details, see .

With the exception of the DNS Server Configuration, the configuration changes described in this section require that you lock and unlock the indicated hosts after the configuration change is made. For more information about locking and unlocking hosts, see .
